content=A well maintained recreation park surrounding a man-made river-lake. Equipped with jogging track, reflexology track, small football/soccer field and gazebos, it is suitable for a leisurely stroll for families as well as after-work sporting activities.
content=Shopping mall with supermarket, fastfood and shops with varieties of local goods.

There are various clothing, fashion, and electronic shops and indoor stalls in the dilapidated Warta Mall (there are also several chemists located on the ground floor) and Kompleks PKNS which feature mostly Muslim-themed wear. Both malls are about 20 to 30 minutes walk from the Hotel Equatorial Bangi.
The new shoplot developments in and around the township has various dining outlets and also local eateries such as Mamak stalls and mobile

vendors. In the older section of the township, outdoor food courts are also popular and satay can generally be found easily. Tom yam, seafood, and 'sup gearbox' stalls can be found on a major road connecting the township to the SILK Highway

value: content=Popular spot for coffee, teh tarik and toast bread, albeit a bit pricey.
content=Two McDonald's outlets, including a recently completed Drive-Thru next to the Kompleks PKNS

As the township consists mostly of Malay-Muslims, there are no entertainment outlets serving alcohol and is generally a 'dry' area except at the Hotel Equatorial Bangi.

value: content=A five-star hotel with adjacent golf course, situated on a hill overlooking Tasik Cempaka and the new township area.
